pull.title: rpcwallet: Add txindex in ListTransaction
pull.body:
"txindex" indicates location of a payment in transaction.
This and "txid" combined helps exchanges identify single payments.

Users could use "sendmany" to send 2 payments of the same amount to a single address in the same transaction, confuses exchange software.

events.message:
rpcwallet: Add txindex in ListTransaction

"txindex" indicates location of a payment in transaction.
This and "txid" combined helps exchanges identify single payments.

events.body:
Not sure I see the value, because software really should be able to track that without txindex.

But it looks correct, no objections...
This has nothing to do with `-txindex`. It just refers to the output index inside the transaction.
To be compatible with `lockunspent`, I'd use `vout` as field name.
My comment was not referring to -txindex.

So this is the `vout` index? Sounds useful to me.
`txindex` got me confused as well.

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/08f149783684e05f7252062381bfa429e3861b77 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

Glancing at the code, I'm pretty sure CoinJoin-like transactions (where you do not own all of the outputs of a transaction) will result in vout numbers that do not match the transaction, because CWalletTx::GetAmounts skips outputs that don't affect the wallet.

So... NACK from me. Edge cases like CoinJoin-like transactions is why I'm going to start insisting that  changes to the wallet or accounting code come with -regtest-mode regression tests.
Agreed, vout index should count all vouts, not just the ones that affect the current wallet, so that it can be used to globally identify the txid-vout pair.
OK. I'll try add the correct vout.
